titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I read through vol. I. of the C.O.P.E.C report. It deals with "The Nature of God and His Purpose for the World", and is a striking contrast to McDougall's book, which I read yesterday. It is an excellent example of a priori reasoning, and proceeds with courageous indifference to the actual facts which yet it has to deal with.

I practised bowls by myself in the afternoon, and, after tea, started on the "Copec" report on "The Social Function of the Church". Wearying of this after 1Â½ hours, I read a novel "London Mixture" by Mrs Alfred Sidgwick.
